title: rustdoc: stack overflow: rustc_infer::infer::combine::Generalizer

labels.name: I-crash
labels.description: Issue: The compiler crashes (SIGSEGV, SIGABRT, etc). Use I-ICE instead when the compiler panics.

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
I tried this code: ```rust // Issue 22443: Reject code using non-regular types that would // otherwise cause dropck to loop infinitely. use std::marker::PhantomData; struct Digit { elem: T } struct Node { m: PhantomData<&'static T> } enum FingerTree { Single(T), // Bug report said Digit after Box would stack overflow (versus // Digit before Box; see dropck_no_diverge_on_nonregular_2). Deep( Box>>, Digit, ) } fn main() { let ft = //~ ERROR overflow while adding drop-check rules for FingerTree FingerTree::Single(1); //~^ ERROR overflow while adding drop-check rules for FingerTree } ``` Instead, this happened: *explanation* ```` thread 'rustc' has overflowed its stack fatal runtime error: stack overflow [1] 4101068 IOT instruction (core dumped) ~/.rustup/toolchains/master/bin/rustdoc ```` ### Meta `rustdoc --version --verbose`: ``` rustdoc 1.63.0-nightly (d40f24e95 2022-06-16) binary: rustdoc commit-hash: d40f24e956a698e47a209541031c4045acc5a684 commit-date: 2022-06-16 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.63.0-nightly LLVM version: 14.0.5 ``` The recursion seems to happem somewhere here:
Backtrace

``` #85 0x00007ffff5e77f64 in rustc_middle::ty::relate::super_relate_tys:: () from /home/matthias/.rustup/toolchains/master/bin/../lib/librustc_driver-e1f5a2a7d671876e.so #86 0x00007ffff5ea1300 in ::tys () from /home/matthias/.rustup/toolchains/master/bin/../lib/librustc_driver-e1f5a2a7d671876e.so #87 0x00007ffff5e77f64 in rustc_middle::ty::relate::super_relate_tys:: () from
